sen.j: 坂上熊毛（さかのうえのくまけ、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: Sakanoue no Kumake (dates of his birth and death unknown) was a figure in the Asuka period.
SAKANOUE no Kumake (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: Sakanoue→SAKANOUE と修正しました。dates of his birth→year of birth,figure→person と修正しました。
sen.e: SAKANOUE no Kumake (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「さかのうへのくまけ」。
sen.e: He was also called "Sakanouhe no Kumake," according to old Japanese syllabify characters.
He was also called 'Sakanouhe no Kumake,' according to old Japanese syllabary characters.
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。syllabify→syllabary,ここでは”読み”のことを言っているので苗字は大文字に修正していません。
sen.e: He was also called 'Sakanouhe no Kumake,' according to old Japanese syllabary characters.

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は直。
sen.e: His Kabane (the surname) was Atae.
His Kabane (surname) was Atae.
His Kabane (surname) was Atae.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱のとき飛鳥の留守司で、大海人皇子側に内応した。
sen.e: He served as a Rusutsukasa (a guard of the City) in the Jinshin War in 672 and sided with Prince Oama for betrayal.
He served as a Rusutsukasa (a guard of the city) of Asuka in the Jinshin War in 672 and secretly sided with Prince Oama.
sen.cmt: City→city,スペースの修正をしました。”飛鳥の”を補いました。for betrayal→secretly と修正しました。
sen.e: He served as a Rusutsukasa (a guard of the city) of Asuka in the Jinshin War in 672 and secretly sided with Prince Oama.

sen.j: 「坂上系図」によれば、父は坂上甲由、祖父は坂上駒子。
sen.e: According to ' the genealogy of the Sakanoue family,' his father was Sakanoue no 甲由 and his grand father was Sakanoue no 駒子.
According to 'the genealogy of the Sakanoue family,' his father was SAKANOUE no 甲由 and his grand father was SAKANOUE no 駒子.
sen.cmt: スペースの修正、Sakanoue→SAKANOUE と修正しました。「甲由、駒子」の読みは確認できておりません。
sen.e: According to 'the genealogy of the Sakanoue family,' his father was SAKANOUE no 甲由 and his grand father was SAKANOUE no 駒子.

sen.j: 同じく壬申の乱で活躍した坂上老は従兄弟である。
sen.e: Sakanoue no Okina, who also showed a great performances in the Jinshin War, was his cousin.
SAKANOUE no Okina, who also showed a great performance in the Jinshin War, was his cousin.
sen.cmt: Sakanoue→SAKANOUE と修正しました。フォントを修正しました。performances→performance と修正しました。
sen.e: SAKANOUE no Okina, who also showed a great performance in the Jinshin War, was his cousin.

sen.j: 父が大和国高市郡の出とされるので、熊毛も同じ可能性が高い。
sen.e: Because his father is said to have come from Takaichi-gun, Yamato Province, he is likely to have come from the same region.
Since his father is said to have come from Takaichi District, Yamato Province, he was likely to have come from the same region.
sen.cmt: Because→Since,Takaichi-gun→Takaichi District,is→was と修正しました。
sen.e: Since his father is said to have come from Takaichi District, Yamato Province, he was likely to have come from the same region.

sen.j: 坂上氏は渡来系の倭漢氏（東漢氏）の一族である。
sen.e: The Sakanoue clan was a family member of the Yamatonoaya clan (the Wakan clan), immigrants to ancient Japan.
The Sakanoue clan was a family member of the Yamato no Ayauji clan, an immigrant clan to ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: 倭漢氏（東漢氏）=the Yamato no Ayauji clan と確認し、修正しました。immigrants→an immigrant clan と修正しました。
sen.e: The Sakanoue clan was a family member of the Yamato no Ayauji clan, an immigrant clan to ancient Japan.

sen.j: 東漢氏は支族が多く、大和国南部に本拠を持ち、軍事に関与することが多かった。
sen.e: The Wakan clan having many branch families was based in the southern area of Yamato-no-kuni and often involved in military affairs.
The Yamato no Ayauji clan had many branch families based in the southern area of Yamato Province and often involved in military affairs.
sen.cmt: Wakan→Yamato no Ayauji,having→had,was を削除、Yamato-no-kuni→Yamato Province と修正しました。
sen.e: The Yamato no Ayauji clan had many branch families based in the southern area of Yamato Province and often involved in military affairs.

sen.j: 壬申の乱が起こったとき、坂上熊毛は倭京の留守司であった。
sen.e: Sakanoue no Kumake served as a Rusutsukasa of WaKyo (City in Yamato), when the Jinshin War occurred.
SAKANOUE no Kumake was serving as a Rusutsukasa of Wakyo (City in Yamato), when the Jinshin War occurred.
sen.cmt: Sakanoue→SAKANOUE と修正しました。served→was serving,WaKyo→Wakyo と修正しました。
sen.e: SAKANOUE no Kumake was serving as a Rusutsukasa of Wakyo (City in Yamato), when the Jinshin War occurred.

sen.j: 倭京の倭は「やまと」と読む。
sen.e: The Chinese character of Wa of WaKyo can be read as "Yamato."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Chinese character of Wa of WaKyo can be read as 'Yamato.'
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。
sen.e: The Chinese character of Wa of WaKyo can be read as 'Yamato.'

sen.j: 当時近江にあった都と別に留守司が管理していた。
sen.e: Wakyo was managed by Rusutsukasa separately from the then capital in Omi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Wakyo was managed by Rusutsukasa separately from the capital in Omi.
Wakyo was managed by Rusutsukasa separately from the capital in Omi.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』が伝える留守司には他に高坂王がある。
sen.e: "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) describes that Takasaka no Okimi also served as Rusutsukasa.
"Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) describes that Takasaka no Okimi also served as Rusutsukasa.
"Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) describes that Takasaka no Okimi also served as Rusutsukasa.

sen.j: 熊毛は王の同僚か部下であったと推測される。
sen.e: It is assumed that Kumake was a colleague or subordinate of Okimi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is assumed that Kumake was a colleague or subordinate of Okimi.
It is assumed that Kumake was a colleague or subordinate of Okimi.

sen.j: 壬申の年（672年）の6月下旬に大海人皇子が兵を興すと、近江宮にいた大友皇子（弘文天皇）は倭京に使者を派遣して軍を発することを命じた。
sen.e: When Prince Oama raised an army in the last half of June in 672, Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun), who were in Omi no miya, sent envoys to Wakyo and ordered to advance his army.
When Prince Oama raised an army in the last half of June in 672, Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun), who was in Omi no miya, sent envoys to Wakyo and ordered to advance his army.
When Prince Oama raised an army in the last half of June in 672, Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun), who was in Omi no miya, sent envoys to Wakyo and ordered to advance his army.

sen.j: 高坂王は使者の穂積百足、穂積五百枝、物部日向とともに軍の編成を始めた。
sen.e: Takasaka no Okimi started to organize the army along with the envoys--Hozumi no Momotari, Hozumi no Ioe, and Monobe no Himuka.
Takasaka no Okimi started to organize the army along with the envoys, Hozumi no Momotari, Hozumi no Ioe, and Monobe no Himuka.
sen.cmt: --→, と修正しました。「穂積百足、穂積五百枝、物部日向」らは名字かどうかが定かでありませんので、それぞれこのままにしてあります。
sen.e: Takasaka no Okimi started to organize the army along with the envoys, Hozumi no Momotari, Hozumi no Ioe, and Monobe no Himuka.

sen.j: しかしこのとき、大海人皇子側につくことを決めた大伴吹負は挙兵をめざして人数を集めた。
sen.e: At this time, however, OTOMO no Hukei decided to side with Prince Oama and gathered people to raise an army.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処「漢直」の読み方は、以下のサイトを参考にしました。http://www.bell.jp/pancho/hyper-history/persons/person_ya/yamatono-fukuin.html
sen.e: At this time, however, OTOMO no Hukei decided to side with Prince Oama and gathered people to raise an army.
At this time, however, OTOMO no Hukei decided to side with Prince Oama and gathered people to raise an army.

sen.j: また坂上熊毛と相談して、一二の漢直（倭漢直）に内応を求めた。
sen.e: He also called twelve clans of Ayano Atai (Wa no Ayano Atai) for betrayals after discussion with Sakanoue no Kumake.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He also called the 12 clans of Ayano Atai (Wa no Ayano Atai) for betrayals, after the discussion with SAKANOUE no Kumake.
sen.cmt: twelve→the 12,カンマ、the を挿入しました。Sakanoue→SAKANOUE と修正しました。
sen.e: He also called the 12 clans of Ayano Atai (Wa no Ayano Atai) for betrayals, after the discussion with SAKANOUE no Kumake.

sen.j: 6月29日、まず秦熊が使者のふりをして馬に乗って馳せ、以下のような誤報を述べた。
sen.e: On June 29, Hada no Kuma first pretended an envoy and ran on a horse to spread the following false report.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処「」の処理のため、「と誤報を言った。」を入れ、和文を変えてあります。「秦熊」は、wikipediaからしか読みを調べられませんでした。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%A7%A6%E7%86%8A
sen.e: On June 29, Hada no Kuma first pretended to be an envoy and ran on a horse to spread the following false report.
sen.cmt: to be を挿入しました。「秦熊」も名字と名前の順が定かではありませんのでこのままにしてあります。
sen.e: On June 29, Hada no Kuma first pretended to be an envoy and ran on a horse to spread the following false report.

sen.j: 「高市皇子が不破から来て、軍衆が多く従っている」と誤報を流した。
sen.e: "Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) is coming from Fuwa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) is coming from Fuwa, and many armed people are following him.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処カッコとの兼ね合いより、下のセルと一緒にしました。クォーツを修正しました。
sen.e: Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) is coming from Fuwa, and many armed people are following him.'

sen.j: 陣営の兵士は驚いて逃げ散った。
sen.e: Soldiers in the camp were surprised and ran away.
Soldiers in the camp were surprised and ran away.
Soldiers in the camp were surprised and ran away.

sen.j: それから数十騎で乗り込むと、熊毛と諸々の直が内応した。
sen.e: When a dozen of mounded warriors entered the city, Kumake and other clans of Atae betrayed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then a dozen of mounted warriors entered the city, Kumake and other clans of Atae supported them.
sen.cmt: When→Then,mounded→mounted と修正しました。betrayed→supported them と修正しました。
sen.e: Then a dozen of mounted warriors entered the city, Kumake and other clans of Atae supported them.

sen.j: そのため、吹負は難なく指揮権を奪取した
sen.e: As the result, Hukei was successful in capturing the right of command with no difficulty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As the result, Hukei successfully captured the right of command with no difficulty.
sen.cmt: was successful in capturing→successfully captured と修正しました。
sen.e: As the result, Hukei successfully captured the right of command with no difficulty.

sen.j: 熊毛について他に知られることはない。
sen.e: Anything other than the above is unknown.
Anything other than the above is unknown about Kumake.
sen.cmt: about Kumake を補いました。
sen.e: Anything other than the above is unknown about Kumake.
